oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Shiloh MB Church: cornerstone
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of church cornerstone mounted into brick wall of church. The cornerstone reads, " Shiloh Missionary Baptist Church; Founding Pastor: Rev. Daniel L. Gaines; Present Pastor: Rev. A.B. Johnson; Previous Pastors: Rev. A. Thompson, Rev. C.C. Fuller, Rev. L.A. Forman, Rev. R.W. Raines, Rev. D. McReynolds; Deacons: Tom Batts, Charlie Givens, Jim Jarrett, John McReynolds, Walter Moore, William Moore, Elijah Perkins, John Jarrett, William Suddeth, Carl Thompson, Arlie Bowerman, Arthur Dunn, Reuben Moore, John P. Taliferro, Ralph Thompson, Charlie Walton; Present Deacons: Roy Perkins, Chairman, J.P. Moore, Paul Perkins, Moses Moore, James Jarrett, James A. Dunn, Scott Swafford; Founded 1900."

Shiloh Missionary Baptist Church was founded in 1900 by Reverend Daniel L. Gaines. The current building in Cleveland, Tennessee dates to 1980. At the time of fieldwork in 1998, the church building retained "good integrity" and was located in a "small suburban African American community."
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee
